The hotel is right next to the central station, but also walking distance (aboout 15 mins) to the Royal Palace and the entrance of Old town. Since we were there to explore museums and sightseeing, we didn't need to buy tickets for public transport but rather bought a Hop-On Hop-Off boat ticket what is valid for 2 days, and every morning we simply walked to the boat and it took us to all our destinations. It was fun and money-saving. 
The hotel itself is quite fancy for the average folk, like me. Beautiful interior design, super friendly and attentive staff members, quick and hassle-free check in and check out. 
Our room was the perfect size for two people. We got a queen size bed and fit in it nicely, even tho we are both over 100kg. The bed was very comfortable, but some might find it a bit too firm (we do like that). The pillows were ok for sleep, but for propping up our backs and watching tv, they were a bit too small/soft. The bed came with one big cover for couples, but we asked for 2 smaller one instead and they were very nice about it, we got the covers in about 20 mins, after asking for it.  The TV is better than in most hotels I have been at, it is the first time I was able to cast streaming services from my phone and watch whatever I wanted. Other places usually require hdmi cable to do that. 
We also tried out the roof-top bar. The view is breathtaking, the atmosphere is very friendly, cosy, quiet, the music is not super loud (like in other bars) so you can have a nice conversation over a drink. I will definitely return for shorter stays.

One staff member (who was very helpful in many ways) suggested we do our COVID tests in town at a local health facility, but when we checked, there were no available online reservations, and the hotel's testing site was quick and affordable. So I would just suggest that staff may want to recommend the hotel site for testing. The only other thing I wished for was an outlet in the bathroom, but that's really reaching for things to dislike!
Positive Reviews: The beds were super-comfy, the downstairs restaurant was lovely and had good food (nice waiter), the staff was super-helpful, and it was a stone's throw away from the Central Station for the trains/city trams and the City Terminal for the buses/fast train to the airport, which was very convenient. Breakfast was not included but we opted for it the second day and it was great -- plenty of options for all kinds of tastes/nationalities. We also took advantage of the fun pool/jacuzzi (must be reserved ahead). Possibly most convenient of all, there was a COVID testing center on-site where we were able to get tested before our flight back home. Honestly, this hotel checked all my boxes for my wants/needs during our 2-night stay -- and more. A staff member even printed out our tests for us.
